Suap Impor Bawang, KPK Tambah Masa Tahanan Politikus PDIP
04 Nov 2019, 23:51 by ANTARA, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Mantan Anggota Komisi VI DPR dari Partai Demokrasi Indonesia Perjuangan (PDIP) I Nyoman Dhamantra mengenakan rompi tahanan seusai menjalani pemeriksaan di Gedung KPK, Jakarta, Jumat (9/8/2019). (ANTARA FOTO/Dhemas Reviyanto)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Penahanan tersangka kasus suap pengurusan izin impor bawang putih tahun 2019, I Nyoman Dhamantra (INY), diputuskan diperpanjang oleh Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK). Politikus PDI Perjuangan itu bersama lima tersangka lainnya telah ditangkap KPK sejak Agustus.Pada awal Oktober lalu KPK telah memperpanjang penahanan I Nyoman terhitung 7 Oktober hingga 5 November 2019. KPK memperpanjang lagi penahanannya selama sebulan ke depan."Hari ini dilakukan perpanjangan penahanan terhadap tersangka INY selama 30 hari sejak 6 November hingga 5 Desember 2019," kata Febri Diansyah, Juru Bicara KPK, di gedung KPK, Jakarta, Senin (4/11), seperti dikutip dari Antara.I Nyoman, mantan Anggota Komisi IV DPR RI 2014-2019, disangkakan sebagai pihak penerima suap bersama orang kepercayaannya, Mirawati Basri (MBS) dan Elviyanto (ELV). Tiga orang tersangka lainnya merupakan pemberi suap, yakni pemilik PT Cahaya Sakti Agro, Chandry Suanda alias Afung, Doddy Wahyudi dari pihak swasta, dan Zulfikar juga dari pihak swasta. Ketiganya saat ini dalam proses persidangan di Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) Jakarta.Ketiga pemberi suap didakwa telah menyuap I Nyoman sebesar Rp3,5 miliar untuk mendapatkan kuota impor bawang putih. KPK pernah menyatakan menemukan alokasi pemberian fee Rp1.700-Rp1.800 untuk setiap kilogram bawang putih yang diimpor ke dalam negeri.Chandry, Doddy, dan Zulfikar didakwa berdasarkan pasal 5 ayat 1 huruf a atau pasal 13 UU No. 31 tahun 1999 sebagaimana diubah dengan UU No. 20 tahun 2001 tentang Pemberantasan Tindak Pidana Korupsi jo pasal 55 ayat 1 ke-1 jo pasal 64 ayat 1 KUHP.Pada Agustus lalu KPK pernah menyebut perkara suap impor bawang putih ini hampir sama dengan kasus suap impor daging sapi yang pernah ditangani. Meski begitu cara pemberian suap disebut berbeda.KPK menganalisa ada titik lemah pada kementerian, salah satunya terkait koordinasi Kementerian Pertanian dan Kementerian Perdagangan. Keduanya merupakan kementerian yang berwenang memberikan izin impor. (fea)

Bribery Imports Onions, KPK Adds Political Prisoners for PDIP
04 Nov 2019, 23:51 by ANTARA, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Former Member of DPR Commission VI from the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle (PDIP) I Nyoman Dhamantra wears a prisoner vest after undergoing an inspection at the KPK Building, Jakarta, Friday (9/8/2019). (BETWEEN PHOTOS / Dhemas Reviyanto)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The detention of a bribery suspect in handling the 2019 import garlic permit, I Nyoman Dhamantra (INY), was decided to be extended by the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK). The PDI-P politician and five other suspects have been arrested by the KPK since August. In early October the KPK had extended the detention of Nyoman from October 7 to November 5, 2019. The KPK extended its detention for another month. "Today there is an extension of the detention of INY suspects. for 30 days from 6 November to 5 December 2019, "said Febri Diansyah, KPK Spokesperson, at the KPK building, Jakarta, Monday (4/11), as quoted by Antara.I Nyoman, former Member of Commission IV of the Republic of Indonesia Parliament 2014-2019 , allegedly as the recipient of a bribe along with his trusted people, Mirawati Basri (MBS) and Elviyanto (ELV). Three other suspects are bribe givers, namely the owner of PT Cahaya Sakti Agro, Chandry Suanda alias Afung, Doddy Wahyudi from the private sector, and Zulfikar is also from the private party. The three are currently in the trial process at the Jakarta Corruption Court (Tipikor) Jakarta. The three bribe-takers were charged with bribing I Nyoman in the amount of Rp3.5 billion to obtain an import quota of garlic. The KPK once stated finding an allocation of a fee of Rp1,700-Rp1,800 for every kilogram of garlic imported into the country. Chandry, Doddy, and Zulfikar were charged based on article 5 paragraph 1 letter a or article 13 of Law no. 31 of 1999 as amended by Law No. 20 of 2001 concerning the Eradication of Corruption in conjunction with article 55 paragraph 1-1 jo article 64 paragraph 1 of the Criminal Code. In August the KPK once mentioned the case of bribery import bribery is almost the same as the case of bribery imported beef which has been handled. Even so the method of giving bribes is called different. KPK analyzed there were weak points in the ministry, one of which was related to the coordination of the Ministry of Agriculture and the Ministry of Trade. Both are ministries that are authorized to give import licenses. (fea)
